a:5:{s:1:"d";a:3:{i:0;O:8:"stdClass":47:{s:9:"short_des";N;s:10:"article_id";s:4:"7555";s:12:"article_type";s:4:"news";s:3:"uri";s:88:"global-experts-gather-to-address-impacts-regulation-of-digital-transformation-ethical-ai";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:90:"Global Experts Gather to Address Impacts, Regulation of Digital Transformation, Ethical AI";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2023-05-15";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2023";s:12:"posted_month";s:1:"5";s:7:"content";s:2195:"<p><strong>Singapore/London, 15 May 2023: </strong>International experts gathered in a webinar to discuss the far-reaching effects of digital transformation and artificial intelligence (AI) development on economies and societies worldwide. Organised by Access Partnerships, a leading international tech advisory firm, the webinar was a response to the rapid advancements in digital tools, particularly artificial intelligence, that are seen as transforming the ways in which economies and societies operate and behave. The global innovation community, including policymakers, research organisations, the business sector, and civil societies, is debating the impacts of the transformation. The aim is to develop suitable frameworks, international agreements, and regulations that not only support innovation, business creation, and economic growth but also safeguard the privacy of individuals and mitigate risks to citizens&rsquo; wellbeing.</p><p>Dr Giulia Ajmone Marsan, Director for Strategy and Partnerships at the Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA) and Co-Chair of the Inclusion Task Force of Startup20, highlighted the complexity and recent nature of digital transformation and AI developments, the full consequences of which are still not fully understood. She emphasised the need for the global community of experts and innovators to engage in cross-sector discussions and adopt a multi-stakeholder approach where the points of view and concerns of governments, business sectors, academia, and civil society all need to be part of the conversation to identify solutions. She underscored the importance of adapting education systems and training programmes to align with new technologies, such as creative thinking and the ability to discern reliable sources of information online.</p><p>The other panellists were Ms Caitlin Corrigan, Executive Director of the Institute for Ethics in Artificial Intelligence; Mr Colin Christie, Chair of the Advisory Committee, Analytics Association of the Philippines; and Ms Mojca Cargo, Senior Manager at AI4!, GSMA. The event was convened and moderated by Mr Jonathan Gonzalez, Senior Policy Manager at Access Partnership.</p>";s:10:"image_name";s:124:"/uploads/news/20230515/2023_may_global-experts-gather-to-address-impacts-regulation-of-digital-transformation-ethical-ai.jpg";s:9:"video_url";s:43:"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6JSla_weLyc";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:0:"";s:5:"major";s:0:"";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"keywords";s:4757:"Global Experts Gather to Address Impacts, Regulation of Digital Transformation, Ethical AI Global Experts Gather to Address Impacts, Regulation of Digital Transformation, Ethical AI Singapore/London, 15 May 2023: International experts gathered in a webinar to discuss the far-reaching effects of digital transformation and artificial intelligence (AI) development on economies and societies worldwide. Organised by Access Partnerships, a leading international tech advisory firm, the webinar was a response to the rapid advancements in digital tools, particularly artificial intelligence, that are seen as transforming the ways in which economies and societies operate and behave. The global innovation community, including policymakers, research organisations, the business sector, and civil societies, is debating the impacts of the transformation. The aim is to develop suitable frameworks, international agreements, and regulations that not only support innovation, business creation, and economic growth but also safeguard the privacy of individuals and mitigate risks to citizens&rsquo; wellbeing.
Dr Giulia Ajmone Marsan, Director for Strategy and Partnerships at the Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA) and Co-Chair of the Inclusion Task Force of Startup20, highlighted the complexity and recent nature of digital transformation and AI developments, the full consequences of which are still not fully understood. She emphasised the need for the global community of experts and innovators to engage in cross-sector discussions and adopt a multi-stakeholder approach where the points of view and concerns of governments, business sectors, academia, and civil society all need to be part of the conversation to identify solutions. She underscored the importance of adapting education systems and training programmes to align with new technologies, such as creative thinking and the ability to discern reliable sources of information online.
The other panellists were Ms Caitlin Corrigan, Executive Director of the Institute for Ethics in Artificial Intelligence; Mr Colin Christie, Chair of the Advisory Committee, Analytics Association of the Philippines; and Ms Mojca Cargo, Senior Manager at AI4!, GSMA. The event was convened and moderated by Mr Jonathan Gonzalez, Senior Policy Manager at Access Partnership.             2023-05-15 15 May 2023 3202 yaM 51 51-50-3202             .pihsrentraP sseccA ta reganaM yciloP roineS ,zelaznoG nahtanoJ rM yb detaredom dna denevnoc saw tneve ehT .AMSG ,!4IA ta reganaM roineS ,ograC acjoM sM dna ;senippilihP eht fo noitaicossA scitylanA ,eettimmoC yrosivdA eht fo riahC ,eitsirhC niloC rM ;ecnegilletnI laicifitrA ni scihtE rof etutitsnI eht fo rotceriD evitucexE ,nagirroC niltiaC sM erew stsillenap rehto ehT
.enilno noitamrofni fo secruos elbailer nrecsid ot ytiliba eht dna gnikniht evitaerc sa hcus ,seigolonhcet wen htiw ngila ot semmargorp gniniart dna smetsys noitacude gnitpada fo ecnatropmi eht derocsrednu ehS .snoitulos yfitnedi ot noitasrevnoc eht fo trap eb ot deen lla yteicos livic dna ,aimedaca ,srotces ssenisub ,stnemnrevog fo snrecnoc dna weiv fo stniop eht erehw hcaorppa redlohekats-itlum a tpoda dna snoissucsid rotces-ssorc ni egagne ot srotavonni dna strepxe fo ytinummoc labolg eht rof deen eht desisahpme ehS .dootsrednu ylluf ton llits era hcihw fo secneuqesnoc lluf eht ,stnempoleved IA dna noitamrofsnart latigid fo erutan tnecer dna ytixelpmoc eht dethgilhgih ,02putratS fo ecroF ksaT noisulcnI eht fo riahC-oC dna )AIRE( aisA tsaE dna NAESA rof etutitsnI hcraeseR cimonocE eht ta spihsrentraP dna ygetartS rof rotceriD ,nasraM enomjA ailuiG rD
.gniebllew ;ouqsr&snezitic ot sksir etagitim dna slaudividni fo ycavirp eht draugefas osla tub htworg cimonoce dna ,noitaerc ssenisub ,noitavonni troppus ylno ton taht snoitaluger dna ,stnemeerga lanoitanretni ,skrowemarf elbatius poleved ot si mia ehT .noitamrofsnart eht fo stcapmi eht gnitabed si ,seiteicos livic dna ,rotces ssenisub eht ,snoitasinagro hcraeser ,srekamycilop gnidulcni ,ytinummoc noitavonni labolg ehT .evaheb dna etarepo seiteicos dna seimonoce hcihw ni syaw eht gnimrofsnart sa nees era taht ,ecnegilletni laicifitra ylralucitrap ,sloot latigid ni stnemecnavda dipar eht ot esnopser a saw ranibew eht ,mrif yrosivda hcet lanoitanretni gnidael a ,spihsrentraP sseccA yb desinagrO .ediwdlrow seiteicos dna seimonoce no tnempoleved )IA( ecnegilletni laicifitra dna noitamrofsnart latigid fo stceffe gnihcaer-raf eht ssucsid ot ranibew a ni derehtag strepxe lanoitanretnI :3202 yaM 51 ,nodnoL/eropagniS IA lacihtE ,noitamrofsnarT latigiD fo noitalugeR ,stcapmI sserddA ot rehtaG strepxE labolG IA lacihtE ,noitamrofsnarT latigiD fo noitalugeR ,stcapmI sserddA ot rehtaG strepxE labolG";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2023-05-19 15:25:29";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2023-05-19 15:25:50";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"18";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";N;s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";N;s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";s:15:"thumbnail_image";N;}i:1;O:8:"stdClass":47:{s:9:"short_des";N;s:10:"article_id";s:4:"7550";s:12:"article_type";s:4:"news";s:3:"uri";s:74:"transitioning-towards-circular-economy-a-workshop-for-lao-pdr-policymakers";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:75:"Transitioning Towards Circular Economy: A Workshop for Lao PDR Policymakers";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2023-05-11";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2023";s:12:"posted_month";s:1:"5";s:7:"content";s:2780:"<p><strong>Vientiane, 11-12 May 2023:</strong> The transition towards circular economy (CE) presents a unique opportunity for fast-growing ASEAN economies to be resource efficient, competitive, and innovative. With the adoption of the <em>ASEAN Circular Economy Framework</em> in 2021, the region has an ambitious, long-term vision for the circular economy, building on the strengths of existing initiatives and priority areas for implementation. Whilst the Framework serves as an important baseline for the region, the success of CE will depend on how ASEAN countries are able to push more circular thinking and innovation based on policy approaches and market trends.</p><p>To respond to this need in timely manner, ERIA Capacity Building Program, building on the work of the Policy Design Department, held a two-day workshop to support Lao PDR officials to learn appropriate policy approaches towards the implementation of CE. The workshop brought together different ministries focusing on this issue to discuss and share their CE related initiatives. The workshop was co-hosted with the Ministry of Industry and Commerce (MOIC) and held with Australian Government support for the ERIA Capacity Building Program.</p><p>Thirty participants joined the workshop with officials from the Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry, Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment, Ministry of Planning and Investment, Ministry of Public Works and Transport, the Ministry of Energy and Mines in addition to MOIC.</p><p>In the opening session, Mr Yasuhiro Yamada, Special Assistant to ERIA President on Mekong Affairs, shared his remarks on the importance of policymakers&rsquo; ability to design and plan circular economy strategies. &nbsp;Mr Robin Flint, First Secretary of the Australian Embassy in Lao PDR, underlined how collaboration for open innovation and technological exchange will be key to delivering successful CE programs and initiatives. Echoing this sentiment, Mr Saysana SAYAKONE, Director General of the Foreign Trade Department at MOIC called for strong coordination across ministries to further push the implementation of existing domestic strategies, for instance such as the <em>National Green Growth Strategy</em> of Lao PDR. &nbsp;</p><p>The workshop delivered four CE modules with each of modules containing reading materials, a case study, group discussion and a presentation. At the end of the workshop, participants were divided into group and presented their policy initiatives related to CE. The materials were delivered by Dr Norasikin Ahmad Ludin, Deputy Director, Solar Energy, Research Institute (SERI), Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia (UKM) and co-facilitated by Dr Aloun Phonvisay, an expert on natural resources, environment and development in Lao PDR.</p>";s:10:"image_name";s:118:"/uploads/news/20230511/2023_may_transitioning-towards-circular-economy-a-workshop-for-lao-pdr-policymakers_800x450.jpg";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:0:"";s:5:"major";s:0:"";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"keywords";s:5811:"Transitioning Towards Circular Economy: A Workshop for Lao PDR Policymakers Transitioning Towards Circular Economy: A Workshop for Lao PDR Policymakers Vientiane, 11-12 May 2023: The transition towards circular economy (CE) presents a unique opportunity for fast-growing ASEAN economies to be resource efficient, competitive, and innovative. With the adoption of the ASEAN Circular Economy Framework in 2021, the region has an ambitious, long-term vision for the circular economy, building on the strengths of existing initiatives and priority areas for implementation. Whilst the Framework serves as an important baseline for the region, the success of CE will depend on how ASEAN countries are able to push more circular thinking and innovation based on policy approaches and market trends.
To respond to this need in timely manner, ERIA Capacity Building Program, building on the work of the Policy Design Department, held a two-day workshop to support Lao PDR officials to learn appropriate policy approaches towards the implementation of CE. The workshop brought together different ministries focusing on this issue to discuss and share their CE related initiatives. The workshop was co-hosted with the Ministry of Industry and Commerce (MOIC) and held with Australian Government support for the ERIA Capacity Building Program.
Thirty participants joined the workshop with officials from the Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry, Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment, Ministry of Planning and Investment, Ministry of Public Works and Transport, the Ministry of Energy and Mines in addition to MOIC.
In the opening session, Mr Yasuhiro Yamada, Special Assistant to ERIA President on Mekong Affairs, shared his remarks on the importance of policymakers&rsquo; ability to design and plan circular economy strategies. &nbsp;Mr Robin Flint, First Secretary of the Australian Embassy in Lao PDR, underlined how collaboration for open innovation and technological exchange will be key to delivering successful CE programs and initiatives. Echoing this sentiment, Mr Saysana SAYAKONE, Director General of the Foreign Trade Department at MOIC called for strong coordination across ministries to further push the implementation of existing domestic strategies, for instance such as the National Green Growth Strategy of Lao PDR. &nbsp;
The workshop delivered four CE modules with each of modules containing reading materials, a case study, group discussion and a presentation. At the end of the workshop, participants were divided into group and presented their policy initiatives related to CE. The materials were delivered by Dr Norasikin Ahmad Ludin, Deputy Director, Solar Energy, Research Institute (SERI), Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia (UKM) and co-facilitated by Dr Aloun Phonvisay, an expert on natural resources, environment and development in Lao PDR.             2023-05-11 11 May 2023 3202 yaM 11 11-50-3202             .RDP oaL ni tnempoleved dna tnemnorivne ,secruoser larutan no trepxe na ,yasivnohP nuolA rD yb detatilicaf-oc dna )MKU( aisyalaM naasgnabeK itisrevinU ,)IRES( etutitsnI hcraeseR ,ygrenE raloS ,rotceriD ytupeD ,niduL damhA nikisaroN rD yb dereviled erew slairetam ehT .EC ot detaler sevitaitini ycilop rieht detneserp dna puorg otni dedivid erew stnapicitrap ,pohskrow eht fo dne eht tA .noitatneserp a dna noissucsid puorg ,yduts esac a ,slairetam gnidaer gniniatnoc seludom fo hcae htiw seludom EC ruof dereviled pohskrow ehT
;psbn& .RDP oaL fo ygetartS htworG neerG lanoitaN eht sa hcus ecnatsni rof ,seigetarts citsemod gnitsixe fo noitatnemelpmi eht hsup rehtruf ot seirtsinim ssorca noitanidrooc gnorts rof dellac CIOM ta tnemtrapeD edarT ngieroF eht fo lareneG rotceriD ,ENOKAYAS anasyaS rM ,tnemitnes siht gniohcE .sevitaitini dna smargorp EC lufsseccus gnireviled ot yek eb lliw egnahcxe lacigolonhcet dna noitavonni nepo rof noitaroballoc woh denilrednu ,RDP oaL ni yssabmE nailartsuA eht fo yraterceS tsriF ,tnilF niboR rM;psbn& .seigetarts ymonoce ralucric nalp dna ngised ot ytiliba ;ouqsr&srekamycilop fo ecnatropmi eht no skramer sih derahs ,sriaffA gnokeM no tnediserP AIRE ot tnatsissA laicepS ,adamaY orihusaY rM ,noisses gninepo eht nI
.CIOM ot noitidda ni seniM dna ygrenE fo yrtsiniM eht ,tropsnarT dna skroW cilbuP fo yrtsiniM ,tnemtsevnI dna gninnalP fo yrtsiniM ,tnemnorivnE dna secruoseR larutaN fo yrtsiniM ,yrtseroF dna erutlucirgA fo yrtsiniM eht morf slaiciffo htiw pohskrow eht denioj stnapicitrap ytrihT
.margorP gnidliuB yticapaC AIRE eht rof troppus tnemnrevoG nailartsuA htiw dleh dna )CIOM( ecremmoC dna yrtsudnI fo yrtsiniM eht htiw detsoh-oc saw pohskrow ehT .sevitaitini detaler EC rieht erahs dna ssucsid ot eussi siht no gnisucof seirtsinim tnereffid rehtegot thguorb pohskrow ehT .EC fo noitatnemelpmi eht sdrawot sehcaorppa ycilop etairporppa nrael ot slaiciffo RDP oaL troppus ot pohskrow yad-owt a dleh ,tnemtrapeD ngiseD yciloP eht fo krow eht no gnidliub ,margorP gnidliuB yticapaC AIRE ,rennam ylemit ni deen siht ot dnopser oT
.sdnert tekram dna sehcaorppa ycilop no desab noitavonni dna gnikniht ralucric erom hsup ot elba era seirtnuoc NAESA woh no dneped lliw EC fo sseccus eht ,noiger eht rof enilesab tnatropmi na sa sevres krowemarF eht tslihW .noitatnemelpmi rof saera ytiroirp dna sevitaitini gnitsixe fo shtgnerts eht no gnidliub ,ymonoce ralucric eht rof noisiv mret-gnol ,suoitibma na sah noiger eht ,1202 ni krowemarF ymonocE ralucriC NAESA eht fo noitpoda eht htiW .evitavonni dna ,evititepmoc ,tneiciffe ecruoser eb ot seimonoce NAESA gniworg-tsaf rof ytinutroppo euqinu a stneserp )EC( ymonoce ralucric sdrawot noitisnart ehT :3202 yaM 21-11 ,enaitneiV srekamyciloP RDP oaL rof pohskroW A :ymonocE ralucriC sdrawoT gninoitisnarT srekamyciloP RDP oaL rof pohskroW A :ymonocE ralucriC sdrawoT gninoitisnarT";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2023-05-16 16:17:55";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2023-05-16 16:18:37";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"18";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";N;s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";N;s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";s:15:"thumbnail_image";N;}i:2;O:8:"stdClass":47:{s:9:"short_des";N;s:10:"article_id";s:4:"7546";s:12:"article_type";s:4:"news";s:3:"uri";s:92:"erias-dr-alloysius-joko-purwanto-appointed-as-a-member-of-the-jakarta-transportation-council";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:93:"ERIA's Dr Alloysius Joko Purwanto appointed as a member of the Jakarta Transportation Council";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2023-05-10";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2023";s:12:"posted_month";s:1:"5";s:7:"content";s:651:"<p><strong>Jakarta, 10 May 2023:</strong> Dr Alloysius Joko Purwanto, ERIA&#039;s&nbsp;Energy Economist,&nbsp;has been appointed as a member of Jakarta Transportation Council (DTKJ) under the Research and Development Commission for the 2023-2026 period.</p><p><a href="https://dtkj.or.id/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">The Jakarta Transportation Council (DTKJ)</a>, is an independent institution serves as a forum&nbsp;for transparent consultation and coordination between the community and the Regional Government.</p><p>ERIA congratulates&nbsp;Dr Joko and wishes him the best for his services to&nbsp;Jakarta Transportation Council.</p>";s:10:"image_name";s:44:"/uploads/news/20230510/untitled-design-6.png";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:0:"";s:5:"major";s:0:"";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"keywords";s:1519:"ERIA's Dr Alloysius Joko Purwanto appointed as a member of the Jakarta Transportation Council ERIA's Dr Alloysius Joko Purwanto appointed as a member of the Jakarta Transportation Council Jakarta, 10 May 2023: Dr Alloysius Joko Purwanto, ERIA's&nbsp;Energy Economist,&nbsp;has been appointed as a member of Jakarta Transportation Council (DTKJ) under the Research and Development Commission for the 2023-2026 period.
The Jakarta Transportation Council (DTKJ), is an independent institution serves as a forum&nbsp;for transparent consultation and coordination between the community and the Regional Government.
ERIA congratulates&nbsp;Dr Joko and wishes him the best for his services to&nbsp;Jakarta Transportation Council.             2023-05-10 10 May 2023 3202 yaM 01 01-50-3202             .licnuoC noitatropsnarT atrakaJ;psbn&ot secivres sih rof tseb eht mih sehsiw dna okoJ rD;psbn&setalutargnoc AIRE
.tnemnrevoG lanoigeR eht dna ytinummoc eht neewteb noitanidrooc dna noitatlusnoc tnerapsnart rof;psbn&murof a sa sevres noitutitsni tnednepedni na si ,)JKTD( licnuoC noitatropsnarT atrakaJ ehT
.doirep 6202-3202 eht rof noissimmoC tnempoleveD dna hcraeseR eht rednu )JKTD( licnuoC noitatropsnarT atrakaJ fo rebmem a sa detnioppa neeb sah;psbn&,tsimonocE ygrenE;psbn&s'AIRE ,otnawruP okoJ suisyollA rD :3202 yaM 01 ,atrakaJ licnuoC noitatropsnarT atrakaJ eht fo rebmem a sa detnioppa otnawruP okoJ suisyollA rD s'AIRE licnuoC noitatropsnarT atrakaJ eht fo rebmem a sa detnioppa otnawruP okoJ suisyollA rD s'AIRE";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2023-05-15 14:48:40";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2023-05-15 14:50:13";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"19";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";N;s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";N;s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";s:15:"thumbnail_image";N;}}s:1:"g";a:0:{}s:1:"e";O:8:"DateTime":3:{s:4:"date";s:26:"2023-05-22 12:13:02.774579";s:13:"timezone_type";i:3;s:8:"timezone";s:13:"Europe/Berlin";}s:1:"m";N;s:1:"c";N;}
